subject: AI & Agents
title: YOLO: Real-Time Detection
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: YOLO: Real-Time Detection.

hook.text: YOLO detects 80 object types in a single pass at 60 frames per second.

buildup.text: YOLO (You Only Look Once) treats detection as a single regression problem, not a pipeline.

discovery.text: The image is divided into a grid. Each cell predicts boxes and class probabilities.

twist.text: Older methods (R-CNN) used two stages: propose regions, then classify. Much slower.

climax.text: YOLOv8 and beyond add instance segmentation and pose estimation to the same architecture.

quiz.question: What makes YOLO faster than two-stage detectors?
options: It predicts boxes and classes in a single pass
